results.title: Class project: the garbage movie
results.creator_credit: Martin Defalco, Peter Katadotis, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A group of pupils, aged 8-13, start off on a school project to find out all they can about garbage, its composition, its disposal and the impact of its disposal on the environment. The places they visit tell us a lot about the society we live in and about ecology, cities, art and history. The students are shown that what we do today has an impact on what happens tomorrow.

results.title: Class of promise
results.creator_credit: Barbara Sears, John Spotton, John Kramer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Before 1965, not a single woman had received a Master’s degree in Business Administration from the University of Western Ontario. Two decades later, the class of ‘84 was almost 25% female. Class of Promise tracks the progress of selected students and the careers of several female graduates. Their impact on management in the male-dominated business world is considerable, but ultimately they still find themselves wrestling with issues career-oriented men seldom have to face, particularly the conflict between family and work.

results.title: Class lot
results.brief_description:
Gyorgy Peto, an Hungarian businessman and musician, took a large number of home movies. Like many film hobbyists he chose to record the special days and lighter moments in life; his wife Eva on holidays, a new baby being bathed, daughter Kati at her birthday party, and his nightly job playing viola in the Budapest Metropolitan Operetta. Director Peter Forgacs takes these “private histories”, which date from 1946 through to the 1960s, and creates an evocative family portrait, layering the sequences of affectionate domestic images with footage from other sources that reveals the much harsher “official history” of a Jewish family during the Second World War and the communist era of the fifties.

Woven into the soundtrack is the voice of the adult Kati, who reminisces about her youth and her relationship with her parents. As a child of holocaust survivors, there was much that could not be spoken about. Kati remarks, “I always felt things were somewhere else, not where I was.” The more we learn about the experiences of Gyorgy, Eva and their extended family, the more the transient moments of casual happiness captured by the home movies grow in emotional power. This exploration of memory and history, presence and loss is supported by the music of Tibor Szemzo.

results.title: Clash of the carnivores. Window on the wild
results.brief_description: Clash of the carnivores examines the Tasmanian Devil, Tiger Quoll and Eastern Quoll which once ranged across mainland Australia but are now only found in the rugged regions of Tasmania. The competition for a limited food supply is fierce with some unexpected battles and alliances. Healesville Sanctuary features in “Window on the wild” where studies are being undertaken into the lifestyle of nocturnal animals such as the Eastern-barred bandicoot. The sanctuary provides an ideal study locale in addition to a refuge for these highly endangered species.

results.title: Clair de Terre = Earth Light
results.brief_description:
Pierre lives alone with his father in Le Marais district of Paris. He constantly thinks of Tunisia where his mother died when he was only five years old. He finally manages to travel accross to the country of his birth and meets Madame Lariviere, a former friend of the family.

Credits: Director, Guy Gilles ; writers, Guy Gilles ; photography, Guy Gilles, Philippe Rousselot ; music, Jean-Pierre Stora.
Cast: Edwige Feuillere, Annie Girardot, Patrick Jouanne, Roger Hanin, Micheline Presle, Elina Labourdette.

results.title: Civil War and reconstruction: 1861-1877
results.creator_credit: Alvin Yudkoff, Milton Meltzer and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Shows the election of Abraham Lincoln, the establishment of the Confederacy, Civil War, and the problems of reconstruction. Includes the role of African Americans in the Civil War after the emancipation proclamation and the terror in the South following the war. Also includes education of African Americans and activities of the Ku Klux Klan.

results.title: City scene
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, Gordon Burwash, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: No matter where you go in the world, it is in the city square that you see the character and culture of a people. Filmed in Montreal, Athens, and Bangkok, this film makes interesting comparisons of life at the core of three great cities. Photography by Paul Leach.

results.title: City out of time
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrait of Venice that expores the rich legacy of art bequeathed to all. Two hundred years ago Canaletto caught its elusive beauty, and in this film details of his pictures rise before you - spired churches and turreted palaces soar into a blue Mediterranean sky. Narrated by William Shatner. (Award: Vancouver)

results.title: City limits
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Forthright, critical analysis of the problems of North American cities by Jane Jacobs, authority and author of books and articles on the subject. A former New Yorker, she chose to live in Toronto because “it is a city that still has options…it hasn’t made so many mistakes that it’s bound to go downhill.” Her remarks, and what this film shows, will interest all civic and community groups - in fact, all urban dwellers. Photography by Jacques Fogel, Albert Kish, Cameron Gaul, Raymond Dumas.

results.title: City family
results.creator_credit: Richard Moir, Chris McGill, Donald Crombie and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Depicts a working day and evening and a holiday in the life of an average Sydney suburban family, set against a musical background of Debussy piano pieces.
